Title: Synthesis and target annotation of the alkaloid GB18
Summary: A synthetic route to GB18, an alkaloid from the bark of hallucinogenic Galbulimima sp., is developed, enabling its identification as an antagonist of κ- and μ-opioid receptors.

Title: Targeting anti-apoptotic pathways eliminates senescent melanocytes and leads to nevi regression
Summary: Cutaneous hyperpigmented lesions, including nevi, are populated by senescent melanocytes. Here the authors provide evidence for a novel strategy based on combining inhibition of the BCL-2 and MCL1 anti-apoptotic pathways that selectively eliminates senescent melanocytes in culture and in vivo.

Title: DeepPROTACs is a deep learning-based targeted degradation predictor for PROTACs
Summary: The rational design of PROTACs is difficult due to their obscure structure-activity relationship. Here the authors present a deep neural network model - DeepPROTACs - for predicting the degradation capacity of a proposed PROTAC molecule.

Title: Genome-wide association study of the response of patients with diabetic macular edema to intravitreal Anti-VEGF injection
Practical synthesis of the therapeutic leads tigilanol tiglate and its analogues
Summary: Tigilanol tiglate is a therapeutic lead for the treatment of a broad range of cancers. Now, it has been shown that tigilanol tiglate can be synthesized in a time and step economical fashion from phorbol—its naturally abundant biosynthetic precursor. This synthesis provides rapid access to analogues with unprecedented protein kinase C binding activity.

Title: Pharmacological inhibition of Lin28 promotes ketogenesis and restores lipid homeostasis in models of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease
Summary: The Lin28/let-7 axis regulates metabolic pathways in normal and pathological contexts. Here the authors show that pharmacological inhibition of Lin28 protects against lipid accumulation in multiple preclinical models of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease.

Title: Targeting the transcription factor HES1 by L-menthol restores protein phosphatase 6 in keratinocytes in models of psoriasis
Summary: Psoriasis is an inflammatory disease which has proven difficult to cure. Prof. Honglin Wang’s team describes L-menthol for treating models of psoriasis and uncovers the dysfunctional HES1- IGBP1-PP6 axis in psoriasis pathology by using L-menthol as a probe.

Title: New meroterpenoids from a soil-derived fungus Penicillium sp. SSW03M2 GY and their anti-virulence activity
Insulin-like growth factor-binding protein-7 (IGFBP7) links senescence to heart failure
Summary: Zhang et al. show increased blood concentration of IGFBP7 in patients and a mouse model with heart failure (HF). IGFBP7 promotes cardiac senescence by stimulating IGF-1R/IRS/AKT-dependent suppression of FOXO3a, and Igfbp7 deficiency or inhibition attenuates cardiac dysfunction in a pressure overload mouse HF model, suggesting that therapeutic targeting of IGFBP7 might be promising for the treatment of HF.

Title: Treatment of peanut allergy and colitis in mice via the intestinal release of butyrate from polymeric micelles
Summary: Intragastrically delivered polymeric micelles releasing butyrate along the intestinal tract restore barrier-protective responses in mouse models of peanut allergy and colitis.
